Usai Cikini, Tebang Pohon Akan Lanjut di Kramat Jakpus demi Trotoar
07 Nov 2019, 20:42 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - Dinas Bina Marga DKI Jakarta mengaku akan memotong beberapa pohon di trotoar di Kramat, Senen, Jakarta Pusat. Sebelum memotong, mereka memasang poster pengumuman di pohon tersebut.
"Kan biasanya kita kasih tahu. Bahwasanya pohon ini akan ditebang karena bla-bla-bla..., kan ada. Sambil kita tunggu rekomendasi dari Dinas Kehutanan begitu sudah dapat rekomendasi kan orang sudah tahu nih ya, nanti viral lagi saya potong. Viral, padahal sudah dikasi tahu sebelumnya," ucap Kepala Dinas Bina Marga DKI Jakarta Hari Nugroho, saat dihubungi, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Bagi Hari, pohon yang akan ditebang merupakan pohon yang mengganggu struktur trotoar ataupun drainase.
"Iya, nanti sebagian yang kita lihat kalau yang memang sudah keluar, mengganggu drainase kemudian ya memang nganu, ya kita relokasi," ucap Hari.
Hari belum menentukan kapan pohon di Kramat akan ditebang. Mereka masih menunggu rekomendasi dari Dinas Kehutanan.
"Belum (tahu), nanti tunggu Dishut," kata Hari.

After Cikini, Tebang Pohon Will Continue in Kramat Central Jakarta for the sidewalk
Nov 7 2019, 20:42 by Arief Ikhsanudin
Jakarta - The DKI Jakarta Bina Marga Office admits to cutting a number of trees on the sidewalk in Kramat, Senen, Central Jakarta. Before cutting, they put an announcement poster on the tree.
"We usually tell it. That this tree will be cut down because blah-blah-blah ... it's right there. While we wait for recommendations from the Forestry Service once we have a recommendation, people already know, yes, I'll cut the virus again. Viral , even though I was informed beforehand, "said Head of DKI Jakarta Bina Marga Office Hari Nugroho, when contacted on Thursday (11/07/2019).
For Hari, the tree to be cut down is a tree that disturbs the sidewalk or drainage structure.
"Yes, later some of what we see if what is already out, disrupts the drainage and then it is indeed disturbing, yes we are relocating," Hari said.
Hari has not yet determined when the trees in Kramat will be cut down. They are still waiting for recommendations from the Forestry Office.
"Not yet (know), wait for the Forestry Service," said Hari.
